summary: The Defense Health Agency has developed pediatric lead screening, testing, and treatment guidelines for its military medical facilities. The guidance centers on screening and testing children for elevated blood lead levels and reporting results to appropriate authorities. But DHA doesn't oversee adherence to its guidelines. DHA officials told us that they plan to conduct oversight, but didn't provide any documentation of its efforts or details...
title: Defense Health Agency: Oversight Needed to Better Ensure That Children Are Screened, Tested, and Treated for Lead Exposure
